intro: Evolvulus alsinoides var. javanicus, commonly known as the Java morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are trailing or ascending. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive flowers and rapid growth habit.
